text: Anevrina is a genus of phorid flies circumscribed by the Italian naturalist Paolo Lioy in 1864. ==Species== A 2010 paper by the entomologists Paul T. Smith and Brian V. Brown recognized the following extant species: *A. capillata *A. curvinervis *A. glabrata *A. kozaneki *A. luggeri *A. macateei *A. olympiae *A. neotropica *A. sphaeropyge *A. thoracica *A. unispinosa *A. urbana *A. variabilis *A. wyatti , Fossilworks recognizes the following fossil species: * A. huberti * A. oligocaenica * A. shoumayae ==References== ==Further reading== * Category:Phoridae Category:Platypezoidea genera Category:Taxa named by Paolo Lioy
title: Anevrina
